intro: Heterotis seretii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces round, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, wooded areas and can thrive in partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
